title: The War in Afghanistan Comes Home—Literally
sub_head: After volunteering to help refugees, I decided to take in a pregnant mother and her five other children.
body:
‘Are you seeing this?” I called to my husband in the other room. “They’re clinging to the outside of a military jet.”
We watched as dozens of Afghans chased freedom down a runway at the Kabul airport, some choosing to fall to their deaths from a plane rather than live under Taliban rule. I tried to imagine that kind of fear and desperation.
